64 is the default on those, I think.  yes, 64 or 128 is a tad on the low side for Ubuntu with Gnome. Give something like say fluxbox or openbox  try, they use FAR less ram and should be far more responsive.
can I install that from synaptic?
Soemthing that needs a bit more ram, but is also a bit more integrated, would be xfce4.
